meanings.definition: The arrangement of leaves on a stem.
meanings.sent1: The phyllotaxy of the plant showed a spiral pattern of leaf arrangement.
meanings.sent2: The gardener observed the phyllotaxy of the tree to understand its growth pattern.
meanings.sent3: The phyllotaxy of the bush seemed to play a game of hide and seek with the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The phyllotaxy of the vine resembled a carefully choreographed dance on the stem.
meanings.sent5: The intricate phyllotaxy of the fern made it a botanical masterpiece.

meanings.sent1: Botanists delve into phyllotaxy to understand how plants organize their leaves.
meanings.sent2: The textbook on phyllotaxy provided detailed information on leaf patterns.
meanings.sent3: During the class on phyllotaxy, the students had fun creating leaf art.
meanings.sent4: The research on phyllotaxy shed light on the secrets of leaf positioning.
meanings.sent5: The professor's passion for phyllotaxy inspired many students to pursue botany.

meanings.definition: The pattern in which leaves are arranged on a stem.
meanings.sent1: The phyllotaxy of the rose bush displayed a beautiful symmetry in leaf placement.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners often study the phyllotaxy of plants to enhance their cultivation techniques.
meanings.sent3: The phyllotaxy of the tree looked like a natural work of art created by the wind.
meanings.sent4: The intricate phyllotaxy of the succulent amazed botanists with its precision.
meanings.sent5: The unique phyllotaxy of the cactus made it stand out among other desert plants.
